reference.title: Installer Command Line Reference
reference.shortdesc: Command line options of the installer.

section.p: The installers for Windows and Linux creates a file called response.varfile, which records the choices that the user made when running the installer interactively. You can use a response.varfile to set the options for an unintended install. Here is an example of a response.varfile:
section.codeblock: #install4j response file for Oxygen XML Editor 16.0 #Fri Jul 18 21:52:15 EDT 2014 sys.adminRights$Boolean=true sys.programGroupDisabled$Boolean=false createDesktopLinkAction$Boolean=true autoVersionChecking=true sys.fileAssociation.launchers$StringArray="19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19","19" sys.programGroupAllUsers$Boolean=true reportProblem=true downloadResources=true sys.languageId=en sys.installationDir=C\:\\Program Files (x86)\\Oxygen XML Editor 16 createQuicklaunchIconAction$Boolean=true sys.programGroupName=Oxygen XML Editor 16.0 executeLauncherAction$Boolean=true sys.fileAssociation.extensions$StringArray="xml","dita","ditamap","ditaval","xsl","xslt","xspec","xsd","rng","rnc","sch","dtd","mod","ent","nvdl","fo","wsdl","xquery","xq","xqy","xqm","xql","xpl","css","json","xpr"

section.title: Command line parameters
section.p: The installer supports the following command line parameters:

strow.stentry:
Run the installer in unattended mode. The installer will not prompt the user for input during the install. Default settings will be used for all options unless a response.varfile is specified using the -varfile option or individual settings are specified using
- on Windows:
-q
- on Linux:
-q

In unattended mode, the installer does not overwrite files with the same name if a previous version of the is installed in the same folder. The -overwrite parameter added after the -q parameter forces the overwriting of these files.
- on Windows:
-q -overwrite
- on Linux:
-q -overwrite

stentry.p:
To display a console for the unattended installation, add a -console parameter to the command line.
- on Windows:
start /wait -q -console
The use of start /wait on Windows is required to make the installer run in the foreground. It you run it without start /wait, it will run in the background.
- on Linux:
-q -console

strow.stentry:
Points to the location of a response.varfile to be used during an unattended installation. For example:
- on Windows:
-q -varfile response.varfile
- on Linux:
-q -varfile response.varfile

Is used to define a variable to be used by an unattended installation. For example:
- on Windows:
-q -VusageDataCollector=false
- on Linux:
-q -VusageDataCollector=false

section.p: The installation uses the install4j installer. A full list of the command line parameters supported by the install4j installer can be found on the install4j site.
